q-spinner-rings/size.description: Size in CSS units, including unit name or standard size name (xs|sm|md|lg|xl)

q-spinner-rings/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-spinner-tail/size.description: Size in CSS units, including unit name or standard size name (xs|sm|md|lg|xl)

q-spinner-tail/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-splitter/model-value.description: Model of the component defining the size of first panel (or second if using reverse) in the unit specified (for '%' it's the split ratio percent - 0.0 < x < 100.0; for 'px' it's the size in px); Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

q-splitter/reverse.description: Apply the model size to the second panel (by default it applies to the first)

q-splitter/emit-immediately.description: Emit model while user is panning on the separator

q-splitter/horizontal.description: Allows the splitter to split its two panels horizontally, instead of vertically

q-splitter/limits.description: An array of two values representing the minimum and maximum split size of the two panels; When 'px' unit is set then you can use Infinity as the second value to make it unbound on the other side

q-splitter/before-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the 'before' panel

q-splitter/after-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the 'after' panel

q-splitter/separator-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the splitter separator

q-splitter/separator-style.description: Style definitions to be attributed to the splitter separator

q-splitter/dark.description: Applies a default lighter color on the separator; To be used when background is darker; Avoid using when you are overriding through separator-class or separator-style props

q-step/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-step/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-step/caption.description: Stepâ€™s additional information that appears beneath the title

q-step/prefix.description: Step's prefix (max 2 characters) which replaces the icon if step does not has error, is being edited or is marked as done

q-step/done-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-step/done-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-step/active-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-step/active-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-step/error-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-step/error-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-step/error.description: Mark the step as having an error

q-stepper/model-value.description: Model of the component defining the current panel's name; If a Number is used, it does not define the panel's index, but rather the panel's name which can also be an Integer; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:model-value' event) OR use the v-model directive.

q-stepper/keep-alive.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native <keep-alive> component on the content

q-stepper/keep-alive-include.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native include prop for <keep-alive>; Values must be valid Vue component names

q-stepper/keep-alive-exclude.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native exclude prop for <keep-alive>; Values must be valid Vue component names

q-stepper/keep-alive-max.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native max prop for <keep-alive>

q-stepper/animated.description: Enable transitions between panel (also see 'transition-prev' and 'transition-next' props)

q-stepper/infinite.description: Makes component appear as infinite (when reaching last panel, next one will become the first one)

q-stepper/swipeable.description: Enable swipe events (may interfere with content's touch/mouse events)

q-stepper/vertical.description: Put Stepper in vertical mode (instead of horizontal by default)

q-stepper/transition-prev.description: One of Quasar's embedded transitions (has effect only if 'animated' prop is set)

q-stepper/transition-next.description: One of Quasar's embedded transitions (has effect only if 'animated' prop is set)

q-stepper/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-stepper/bordered.description: Applies a default border to the component

q-stepper/alternative-labels.description: Use alternative labels - stacks the icon on top of the label (applies only to horizontal stepper)

q-stepper/contracted.description: Hide header labels on narrow windows

q-stepper/inactive-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-stepper/inactive-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-stepper/done-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-stepper/done-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-stepper/active-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-stepper/active-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-stepper/error-icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; If 'none' (String) is used as value, then it will defer to prefix or the regular icon for this state; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-stepper/error-color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-stepper/header-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the header

q-tab-panel/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-tab-panels/model-value.description: Model of the component defining the current panel's name; If a Number is used, it does not define the panel's index, but rather the panel's name which can also be an Integer; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:model-value' event) OR use the v-model directive.

q-tab-panels/keep-alive.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native <keep-alive> component on the content

q-tab-panels/keep-alive-include.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native include prop for <keep-alive>; Values must be valid Vue component names

q-tab-panels/keep-alive-exclude.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native exclude prop for <keep-alive>; Values must be valid Vue component names

q-tab-panels/keep-alive-max.description: Equivalent to using Vue's native max prop for <keep-alive>

q-tab-panels/animated.description: Enable transitions between panel (also see 'transition-prev' and 'transition-next' props)

q-tab-panels/infinite.description: Makes component appear as infinite (when reaching last panel, next one will become the first one)

q-tab-panels/swipeable.description: Enable swipe events (may interfere with content's touch/mouse events)

q-tab-panels/vertical.description: Default transitions and swipe actions will be on the vertical axis

q-tab-panels/transition-prev.description: One of Quasar's embedded transitions (has effect only if 'animated' prop is set)

q-tab-panels/transition-next.description: One of Quasar's embedded transitions (has effect only if 'animated' prop is set)

q-table/no-route-fullscreen-exit.description: Changing route app won't exit fullscreen

q-table/row-key.description: Property of each row that defines the unique key of each row (the result must be a primitive, not Object, Array, etc); The value of property must be string or a function taking a row and returning the desired (nested) key in the row; If supplying a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-table/virtual-scroll.description: Display data using QVirtualScroll (for non-grid mode only)

q-table/virtual-scroll-target.description: CSS selector or DOM element to be used as a custom scroll container instead of the auto detected one

q-table/virtual-scroll-slice-size.description: Minimum number of rows to render in the virtual list

q-table/virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-befor.description: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render before it

q-table/virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-after.description: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render after it

q-table/virtual-scroll-item-size.description: Default size in pixels of a row; This value is used for rendering the initial table; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of a row

q-table/virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start.description: Size in pixels of the sticky header (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision; Will be also used for non-virtual-scroll tables for fixing top alignment when using scrollTo method

q-table/virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end.description: Size in pixels of the sticky footer part (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

q-table/table-colspan.description: The number of columns in the table (you need this if you use table-layout: fixed)

q-table/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-table/icon-first-page.description: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to first page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-table/icon-prev-page.description: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to previous page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-table/icon-next-page.description: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to next page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-table/icon-last-page.description: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to last page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

q-table/grid.description: Display data as a grid instead of the default table

q-table/dense.description: Dense mode; Connect with $q.screen for responsive behavior

q-table/visible-columns.description: Array of Strings defining column names ('name' property of each column from 'columns' prop definitions); Columns marked as 'required' are not affected by this property

q-table/loading.description: Put Table into 'loading' state; Notify the user something is happening behind the scenes

q-table/hide-bottom.description: Hide table bottom layer regardless of what it has to display

q-table/hide-selected-banner.description: Hide the selected rows banner (if any)

q-table/hide-no-data.description: Hide the default no data bottom layer

q-table/hide-pagination.description: Hide the pagination controls at the bottom

q-table/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-table/bordered.description: Applies a default border to the component

q-table/square.description: Removes border-radius so borders are squared

q-table/separator.description: Use a separator/border between rows, columns or all cells

q-table/binary-state-sort.description: Skip the third state (unsorted) when user toggles column sort direction

q-table/column-sort-order.description: Set column sort order: 'ad' (ascending-descending) or 'da' (descending-ascending); It gets applied to all columns unless a column has its own sortOrder specified in the 'columns' definition prop

q-table/no-data-label.description: Override default text to display when no data is available

q-table/no-results-label.description: Override default text to display when user filters the table and no matched results are found

q-table/loading-label.description: Override default text to display when table is in loading state (see 'loading' prop)

q-table/selected-rows-label.description: Text to display when user selected at least one row; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-table/rows-per-page-label.description: Text to override default rows per page label at bottom of table

q-table/pagination-label.description: Text to override default pagination label at bottom of table (unless 'pagination' scoped slot is used); For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-table/table-style.description: CSS style to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

q-table/table-class.description: CSS classes to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

q-table/table-header-style.description: CSS style to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

q-table/table-header-class.description: CSS classes to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

q-table/card-container-style.description: CSS style to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

q-table/card-container-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

q-table/card-style.description: CSS style to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

q-table/card-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

q-table/title-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the title (if using 'title' prop)

q-table/filter.description: String/Object to filter table with; When using an Object it requires 'filter-method' to also be specified since it will be a custom filtering

q-table/filter-method.description: The actual filtering mechanism; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-table/pagination.description: Pagination object; You can also use the 'v-model:pagination' for synching; When not synching it simply initializes the pagination on first render

q-table/rows-per-page-options.description: Options for user to pick (Numbers); Number 0 means 'Show all rows in one page'

q-table/expanded.description: Keeps the array with expanded rows keys

q-table/sort-method.description: The actual sort mechanism. Function (rows, sortBy, descending) => sorted rows; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-td/auto-width.description: Tries to shrink column width size; Useful for columns with a checkbox/radio/toggle

q-th/props.description: QTable's header column scoped slot property

q-th/auto-width.description: Tries to shrink header column width size; Useful for columns with a checkbox/radio/toggle

q-route-tab/to.description: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'to' property; Superseded by 'href' prop if used

q-route-tab/exact.description: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'exact' property; Superseded by 'href' prop if used

q-route-tab/replace.description: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'replace' property; Superseded by 'href' prop if used

q-route-tab/active-class.description: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'active-class' property; Superseded by 'href' prop if used

q-route-tab/exact-active-class.description: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'active-class' property; Superseded by 'href' prop if used

q-route-tab/href.description: Native <a> link href attribute; Has priority over the 'to'/'exact'/'replace'/'active-class'/'exact-active-class' props

q-route-tab/target.description: Native <a> link target attribute; Use it only along with 'href' prop; Has priority over the 'to'/'exact'/'replace'/'active-class'/'exact-active-class' props

q-route-tab/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-route-tab/label.description: A number or string to label the tab

q-route-tab/alert.description: Adds an alert symbol to the tab, notifying the user there are some updates; If its value is not a Boolean, then you can specify a color

q-route-tab/alert-icon.description: Adds a floating icon to the tab, notifying the user there are some updates; It's displayed only if 'alert' is set; Can use the color specified by 'alert' prop

q-route-tab/no-caps.description: Turns off capitalizing all letters within the tab (which is the default)

q-route-tab/content-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the content wrapper

q-route-tab/ripple.description: Configure material ripple (disable it by setting it to 'false' or supply a config object)

q-tab/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-tab/label.description: A number or string to label the tab

q-tab/alert.description: Adds an alert symbol to the tab, notifying the user there are some updates; If its value is not a Boolean, then you can specify a color

q-tab/alert-icon.description: Adds a floating icon to the tab, notifying the user there are some updates; It's displayed only if 'alert' is set; Can use the color specified by 'alert' prop

q-tab/no-caps.description: Turns off capitalizing all letters within the tab (which is the default)

q-tab/content-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the content wrapper

q-tab/ripple.description: Configure material ripple (disable it by setting it to 'false' or supply a config object)

q-tabs/model-value.description: Model of the component defining current panel name; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

q-tabs/vertical.description: Use vertical design (tabs one on top of each other rather than one next to the other horizontally)

q-tabs/outside-arrows.description: Reserve space for arrows to place them on each side of the tabs (the arrows fade when inactive)

q-tabs/mobile-arrows.description: Force display of arrows (if needed) on mobile

q-tabs/align.description: Horizontal alignment the tabs within the tabs container

q-tabs/breakpoint.description: Breakpoint (in pixels) of tabs container width at which the tabs automatically turn to a justify alignment

q-tabs/active-color.description: The color to be attributed to the text of the active tab

q-tabs/active-bg-color.description: The color to be attributed to the background of the active tab

q-tabs/indicator-color.description: The color to be attributed to the indicator (the underline) of the active tab

q-tabs/content-class.description: Class definitions to be attributed to the content wrapper

q-tabs/active-class.description: The class to be set on the active tab

q-tabs/left-icon.description: The name of an icon to replace the default arrow used to scroll through the tabs to the left, when the tabs extend past the width of the tabs container

q-tabs/right-icon.description: The name of an icon to replace the default arrow used to scroll through the tabs to the right, when the tabs extend past the width of the tabs container

q-tabs/stretch.description: When used on flexbox parent, tabs will stretch to parent's height

q-tabs/shrink.description: By default, QTabs is set to grow to the available space; However, you can reverse that with this prop; Useful (and required) when placing the component in a QToolbar

q-tabs/switch-indicator.description: Switches the indicator position (on left of tab for vertical mode or above the tab for default horizontal mode)

q-tabs/narrow-indicator.description: Allows the indicator to be the same width as the tab's content (text or icon), instead of the whole width of the tab

q-tabs/inline-label.description: Allows the text to be inline with the icon, should one be used

q-tabs/no-caps.description: Turns off capitalizing all letters within the tab (which is the default)

q-time/name.description: Used to specify the name of the control; Useful if dealing with forms submitted directly to a URL

q-time/landscape.description: Display the component in landscape mode

q-time/mask.description: Mask (formatting string) used for parsing and formatting value

q-time/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-time/text-color.description: Overrides text color (if needed); Color name from the Quasar Color Palette

q-time/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-time/square.description: Removes border-radius so borders are squared

q-time/bordered.description: Applies a default border to the component

q-time/model-value.description: Time of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

q-time/format24h.description: Forces 24 hour time display instead of AM/PM system

q-time/default-date.description: The default date to use (in YYYY/MM/DD format) when model is unfilled (undefined or null)

q-time/options.description: Optionally configure what time is the user allowed to set; Overridden by 'hour-options', 'minute-options' and 'second-options' if those are set; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-time/hour-options.description: Optionally configure what hours is the user allowed to set; Overrides 'options' prop if that is also set

q-time/minute-options.description: Optionally configure what minutes is the user allowed to set; Overrides 'options' prop if that is also set

q-time/second-options.description: Optionally configure what seconds is the user allowed to set; Overrides 'options' prop if that is also set

q-time/with-seconds.description: Allow the time to be set with seconds

q-time/now-btn.description: Display a button that selects the current time

q-timeline/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-timeline/side.description: Side to place the timeline entries in dense and comfortable layout; For loose layout it gets overridden by QTimelineEntry side prop

q-timeline/layout.description: Layout of the timeline. Dense keeps content and labels on one side. Comfortable keeps content on one side and labels on the opposite side. Loose puts content on both sides.

q-timeline/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-timeline-entry/tag.description: Tag to use, if of type 'heading' only

q-timeline-entry/side.description: Side to place the timeline entry; Works only if QTimeline layout is loose.

q-timeline-entry/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-timeline-entry/avatar.description: URL to the avatar image; Icon takes precedence if used, so it replaces avatar

q-timeline-entry/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-timeline-entry/title.description: Title of timeline entry; Is overridden if using 'title' slot

q-timeline-entry/subtitle.description: Subtitle of timeline entry; Is overridden if using 'subtitle' slot

q-timeline-entry/body.description: Body content of timeline entry; Use this prop or the default slot

q-toggle/name.description: Used to specify the name of the control; Useful if dealing with forms submitted directly to a URL

q-toggle/size.description: Size in CSS units, including unit name or standard size name (xs|sm|md|lg|xl)

q-toggle/model-value.description: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:model-value' event) OR use v-model directive

q-toggle/val.description: Works when model ('value') is Array. It tells the component which value should add/remove when ticked/unticked

q-toggle/true-value.description: What model value should be considered as checked/ticked/on?

q-toggle/false-value.description: What model value should be considered as unchecked/unticked/off?

q-toggle/indeterminate-value.description: What model value should be considered as 'indeterminate'?

q-toggle/toggle-order.description: Determines toggle order of the two states ('t' stands for state of true, 'f' for state of false); If 'toggle-indeterminate' is true, then the order is: indet -> first state -> second state -> indet (and repeat), otherwise: indet -> first state -> second state -> first state -> second state -> ...

q-toggle/toggle-indeterminate.description: When user clicks/taps on the component, should we toggle through the indeterminate state too?

q-toggle/label.description: Label to display along the component (or use the default slot instead of this prop)

q-toggle/left-label.description: Label (if any specified) should be displayed on the left side of the component

q-toggle/checked-icon.description: The icon to be used when the toggle is on

q-toggle/unchecked-icon.description: The icon to be used when the toggle is off

q-toggle/indeterminate-icon.description: The icon to be used when the model is indeterminate

q-toggle/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-toggle/keep-color.description: Should the color (if specified any) be kept when the component is unticked/ off?

q-toggle/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-toggle/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-toggle/icon-color.description: Override default icon color (for truthy state only); Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-toolbar/inset.description: Apply an inset to content (useful for subsequent toolbars)

q-toolbar-title/shrink.description: By default, QToolbarTitle is set to grow to the available space. However, you can reverse that with this prop

q-tooltip/model-value.description: Model of the component defining shown/hidden state; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:model-value' event) OR use v-model directive

q-tooltip/max-height.description: The maximum height of the Tooltip; Size in CSS units, including unit name

q-tooltip/max-width.description: The maximum width of the Tooltip; Size in CSS units, including unit name

q-tooltip/anchor.description: Two values setting the starting position or anchor point of the Tooltip relative to its target

q-tooltip/self.description: Two values setting the Tooltip's own position relative to its target

q-tooltip/offset.description: An array of two numbers to offset the Tooltip horizontally and vertically in pixels

q-tooltip/scroll-target.description: CSS selector or DOM element to be used as a custom scroll container instead of the auto detected one

q-tooltip/target.description: Configure a target element to trigger Tooltip toggle; 'true' means it enables the parent DOM element, 'false' means it disables attaching events to any DOM elements; By using a String (CSS selector) it attaches the events to the specified DOM element (if it exists)

q-tooltip/no-parent-event.description: Skips attaching events to the target DOM element (that trigger the element to get shown)

q-tooltip/delay.description: Configure Tooltip to appear with delay

q-tooltip/hide-delay.description: Configure Tooltip to disappear with delay

q-tree/nodes.description: The array of nodes that designates the tree structure

q-tree/node-key.description: The property name of each node object that holds a unique node id

q-tree/label-key.description: The property name of each node object that holds the label of the node

q-tree/children-key.description: The property name of each node object that holds the list of children of the node

q-tree/no-connectors.description: Do not display the connector lines between nodes

q-tree/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-tree/control-color.description: Color name for controls (like checkboxes) from the Quasar Color Palette

q-tree/text-color.description: Overrides text color (if needed); Color name from the Quasar Color Palette

q-tree/selected-color.description: Color name for selected nodes (from the Quasar Color Palette)

q-tree/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-tree/icon.description: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If 'none' (String) is used as value then no icon is rendered (but screen real estate will still be used for it)

q-tree/tick-strategy.description: The type of strategy to use for the selection of the nodes

q-tree/ticked.description: Keys of nodes that are ticked

q-tree/expanded.description: Keys of nodes that are expanded

q-tree/no-selection-unset.description: Do not allow un-selection when clicking currently selected node

q-tree/default-expand-all.description: Allow the tree to have all its branches expanded, when first rendered

q-tree/accordion.description: Allows the tree to be set in accordion mode

q-tree/no-transition.description: Turn off transition effects when expanding/collapsing nodes; Also enhances perf by a lot as a side-effect; Recommended for big trees

q-tree/filter.description: The text value to be used for filtering nodes

q-tree/filter-method.description: The function to use to filter the tree nodes; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-tree/no-nodes-label.description: Override default such label for when no nodes are available

q-tree/no-results-label.description: Override default such label for when no nodes are available due to filtering

q-uploader/factory.description: Function which should return an Object or a Promise resolving with an Object; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/url.description: URL or path to the server which handles the upload. Takes String or factory function, which returns String. Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/method.description: HTTP method to use for upload; Takes String or factory function which returns a String; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/field-name.description: Field name for each file upload; This goes into the following header: 'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="__HERE__"; filename="somefile.png"; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/headers.description: Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with header definitions; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/form-fields.description: Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with additional fields definitions (used by Form to be uploaded); Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/with-credentials.description: Sets withCredentials to true on the XHR that manages the upload; Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/send-raw.description: Send raw files without wrapping into a Form(); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/batch.description: Upload files in batch (in one XHR request); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/accept.description: Comma separated list of unique file type specifiers. Maps to 'accept' attribute of native input type=file element

q-uploader/capture.description: Optionally, specify that a new file should be captured, and which device should be used to capture that new media of a type defined by the 'accept' prop. Maps to 'capture' attribute of native input type=file element

q-uploader/max-file-size.description: Maximum size of individual file in bytes

q-uploader/max-total-size.description: Maximum size of all files combined in bytes

q-uploader/max-files.description: Maximum number of files to contain

q-uploader/filter.description: Custom filter for added files; Only files that pass this filter will be added to the queue and uploaded; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-uploader/color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

q-uploader/text-color.description: Overrides text color (if needed); Color name from the Quasar Color Palette

q-uploader/dark.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

q-uploader/square.description: Removes border-radius so borders are squared

q-uploader/bordered.description: Applies a default border to the component

q-uploader/no-thumbnails.description: Don't display thumbnails for image files

q-video/ratio.description: Aspect ratio for the content; If value is a String, then avoid using a computational statement (like '16/9') and instead specify the String value of the result directly (eg. '1.7777')

q-video/src.description: The source url to display in an iframe

q-video/title.description: (Accessibility) Set the native 'title' attribute value of the inner iframe being used

q-video/fetchpriority.description: Provides a hint of the relative priority to use when fetching the iframe document

q-video/loading.description: Indicates how the browser should load the iframe

q-video/referrerpolicy.description: Indicates which referrer to send when fetching the frame's resource

q-virtual-scroll/virtual-scroll-horizont.description: Make virtual list work in horizontal mode

q-virtual-scroll/virtual-scroll-slice-si.description: Minimum number of items to render in the virtual list

q-virtual-scroll/virtual-scroll-slice-ra.description: Ratio of number of items in visible zone to render before it
Ratio of number of items in visible zone to render after it

q-virtual-scroll/virtual-scroll-item-siz.description: Default size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of an item; This value is used for rendering the initial list; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of an item

q-virtual-scroll/virtual-scroll-sticky-s.description: Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the start of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision
Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the end of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

q-virtual-scroll/table-colspan.description: The number of columns in the table (you need this if you use table-layout: fixed)

q-virtual-scroll/type.description: The type of content: list (default) or table

q-virtual-scroll/items.description: Available list items that will be passed to the scoped slot; For best performance freeze the list of items; Required if 'itemsFn' is not supplied

q-virtual-scroll/items-size.description: Number of available items in the list; Required and used only if 'itemsFn' is provided

q-virtual-scroll/items-fn.description: Function to return the scope for the items to be displayed; Should return an array for items starting from 'from' index for size length; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

q-virtual-scroll/scroll-target.description: CSS selector or DOM element to be used as a custom scroll container instead of the auto detected one
